text:
Ordered Teh Halia less sweet and Ice Teh less sweet. Our usual orders.

This used to be our favourite stall with consistent products. Usually the 2 bros are very friendly too.

Today, they served both with full sweetness. Which is fine, we all make mistakes when we are busy right.

What was unacceptable was how when I gave feedback civilly, the stall operator gave me a smirk and walked away. The other lady moderated the situation and modified the drinks unwillingly before they disregarded me again.

The drinks also remained very sweet with inadequate tea potency.

Hope bros will regain their standard in the future.

Brought my niece to get some drinks, we bought blueberry drink and teh halia. The staff there were so nice ! Gave my niece a candy and it made her day ðŸ˜‚ flavours of the drinks was nice as well and pricing wise itâ€™s affordable with the economy now! Definitely will be my go to shop if I visit Ayer Rajah food centre again!!.
Teh halia was quite good - ginger taste was strong but tea was quite weak. Large mug for only $1.50. E-payment available.

Very friendly family business (I think). Serve many local drinks, from Tea, coffee to milo, hoclick to special flavor like hot tea with ginger juice. Not really cheap, but still a acceptable price range.

Becareful of this shop trap. They dont ask customer what size you want. Ordered cold drinks and all 5 cup came large by default and all 5 cups cost me $20 regardless of teh o, sugar cane, lime juice or lemon tea. Felt cheated and learnt my lesson.
